original_title: PUCSL not pleased with CEB tariff reduction
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) said the Ceylon Electricity Board has not proposed an electricity tariff reduction to the extent expected by the people.
PUCSL Chairman Janaka Ratnayake said this was revealed when observing the proposal submitted for the approval of the commission, to reduce electricity tariffs.
The Ministry of Power and Energy said on Tuesday (16) that the proposal to reduce electricity tariffs from the 1st of July was forwarded to the PUCSL for approval.
Janaka Ratnayake said a stringent study must be conducted regarding the proposals.
He added that further data was also requested from the CEB, and approval will be granted within the next three days.
